results.overview: When Dracula leaves the captive Jonathan Harker and Transylvania for London in search of Mina Murray, the reincarnation of Dracula's long-dead wife Elisabeta, obsessed vampire hunter Dr. Van Helsing sets out to end the madness.
results.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula

results.overview: Making 'Bram Stoker's Dracula' by Francis Ford Coppola.
results.title: Making 'Bram Stoker's Dracula'

results.overview: When Bram Stoker first published his novel "Dracula" at the end of the 19th Century, few could have predicted the impact his literary vision would generate, especially the critics, who were far from receptive to his work. However, the readers of the day took Dracula to their hearts and delighted in the horror of the novel. And of course as the Hollywood movie industry developed, "Dracula" proved a perfect candidate for the silver screen. "Dracula" has become a classic icon of the horror industry, complete with swirling black cape and dripping fangs - thrilling and terrifying readers and moviegoers for more than a century, and all indications are that Dracula will continue to do so for all eternity
results.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula - A Documentary

results.original_title: The Blood Is the Life: The Making of 'Bram Stoker's Dracula'
results.overview: Director Francis Ford Coppola, cast and production crew explore the making of the 1992 masterpiece.
results.title: The Blood Is the Life: The Making of 'Bram Stoker's Dracula'

results.overview: The Romanian count known as Dracula is summoned to London by Arthur Holmwood, a young Lord who is one the verge of being wed. Unknown to Arthur's future bride Lucy, her future husband is infected with syphilis and therefore cannot consummate their marriage. Arthur has laid his hopes of being cured on the enigmatic count; as it is said that Dracula has extraordinary powers. But these supernatural powers have sinister origins. The Count is a vampire. Soon Arthur realizes his serious mistake as all hell breaks loose and the Count infects others with his ancient curse. But Dracula has not counted on the young Lord acquiring the assistance of the Dutch Vampire expert Prof. Abraham Van Helsing.
results.title: Dracula

results.original_title: In Camera: The Naïve Visual Effects of 'Bram Stoker's Dracula'
results.overview: Director Francis Ford Coppola and production staff reveal the secrets behind the 1992 masterpiece.
results.title: In Camera: The Naïve Visual Effects of 'Bram Stoker's Dracula'

results.original_title: Reflections in Blood: Francis Ford Coppola and Bram Stoker’s Dracula
results.overview: Francis Ford Coppola expanding his love of the film.
results.title: Reflections in Blood: Francis Ford Coppola and Bram Stoker’s Dracula

results.overview: Dracula is searching for a woman who looks like his long dead wife.
results.title: Dracula

results.overview: Based upon Bram Stoker's short stories, Dracula's Guest follows the story of two young lovers, Bram and Elizabeth, who are forced by her father, the Admiral Murray, to take a one year probation from their relationship in order to determine whether their love is true. Meanwhile, the Count Dracula is in London searching for a new home and coincidentally, or not, comes across young Elizabeth at the train station after she's run away from home and her father's overbearing ways. Dracula, though, proceeds to kidnap her and take Elizabeth to his castle where he waits for her father's arrival to settle an ancient dispute. Meanwhile, Bram' friend Malcolm sets out to inform Bram of Elizabeth' kidnapping but he soon falls to Dracula's evil ways. And, upon finding his best friend dead Bram sets out across Europe to rescue his true love.
results.title: Dracula's Guest

results.overview: A team of vampire hunters set out to battle an evil vampire clan in the dark underworld.
results.title: Dracula's Curse

results.overview: Jess Franco's version of the Bram Stoker classic has Count Dracula as an old man who grows younger whenever he dines on the blood of young maidens.
results.title: Count Dracula
